definition: to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: And BedelL listened as she told him about her brothers and about James.
sentences.chinese: 比德尔也倾听她讲述他的兄弟和丈夫詹姆斯的事。

sentences.english: There was only one person in Townsville at this moment to whom she could appeal for a hearing.
sentences.chinese: 现在镇子上唯一一个能够倾听她说话的人就是苏珊了。

sentences.english: They need to be heard and understood.
sentences.chinese: 她们需要别人的倾听和理解。

sentences.english: The United States, according to Hormats, should listen to and carefully consider input from emerging economies.
sentences.chinese: 霍马茨说，美国应倾听并认真考虑新兴经济体的意见。

sentences.english: Trust your instincts and listen "with a third ear".
sentences.chinese: 相信你的直觉并用第三只耳朵倾听。

sentences.english: A good company listens to what its customers say they want.
sentences.chinese: 一个好的公司，善于倾听用户的想法。

sentences.english: And, again, the husband should listen and repeat her points.
sentences.chinese: 而丈夫还是倾听并复述妻子说话的内容。

sentences.english: Sitting in the corner listening, watching everybody, taking notes.
sentences.chinese: 坐在角落里倾听，看着每个人，做笔记。

sentences.english: It would be better if he simply lent a sympathetic ear.
sentences.chinese: 其实他们只要支着耳朵同情地倾听就行了。

sentences.english: He followed the speaker's words with the greatest attention.
sentences.chinese: 他专心一意地倾听演讲者的话。

sentences.english: One usually pricks up one's ears when his name is called.
sentences.chinese: 人在被叫到自己的名字时，通常要侧耳倾听。

sentences.english: Listen to your thoughts. See the details of your surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 倾听自己的心思，观察身边的每一个小细节。

sentences.english: Sometimes even the listening and empathizing can help you pull out of things on your own.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，仅仅是倾听和重点分析就可以帮你解决问题。

sentences.english: She gained the ear of the managing director and voiced her opinion.
sentences.chinese: 她说的话总经理愿意倾听，于是她就直抒己见了。

sentences.english: List to the voice that speaks of the past-time.
sentences.chinese: 倾听谈论过去时间的声音。

definition: to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
